term.title: selectivity

item.text: (qualitative): The extent to which other substances interfere with the determination of a substance according to a given procedure.
(quantitative): A term used in conjunction with another substantive (e.g. constant, coefficient, index, factor, number) for the quantitative characterization of interferences.

term.sources: 'Recommendations for the usage of selective, selectivity and related terms in analytical chemistry' Den Boef, G.;Hulanicki, A.; Pure and Applied Chemistry 1983 55(3) 553
